titlestmt.titleproper: PG 740, Frank A. Lajoie and Gary J. Horton World War I Poster Collection
titlestmt.subtitle: Inventory of Posters
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Allen Ramsey.

publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2013 by the Connecticut State Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Allen Ramsey on >July 22, 2013

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.unittitle: Frank A. Lajoie and Gary J. Horton World War I Poster collection
did.abstract: Frank A. Lajoie was business manager of the business office for the Meriden Record Co. in Meriden where he collected the 29 World War I posters found in this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Francis (Frank) A. Lajoie was born on November 3, 1880 to David and Salina Codette Lajoie in Meriden, Connecticut. Francis married Alma Munn on June 15, 1910, at St. Laurent's Church in Meriden. He was business manager of the business office for the Meriden Record Co. in Meriden where he collected the World War I posters found in this collection. He then went on to work for the Aetna Life Insurance Company in Hartford for 40 years retiring in 1958. Francis A. Lajoie died in Willimantic, Windham County, Connecticut on July 12, 1979.

Francis (Frank) A. and Alma Munn Lajoie were married in 1910. In 1921, they had a daughter Vivian Shirley Lajoie. Vivian and John Edmund Horton were married on September 8, 1945. Vivian and John Horton had four children: Gregory, Gail, Gary, and James. Gary J. Horton is the grandson of Francis A. Lajoie.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 29 World War I posters.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Frank A. Lajoie and Gary J. Horton World War I Poster collection was donated by Gary J. Horton to the Connecticut State Library on May 30, 2013.
